com.samsung.android.sdk

Interface SsdkInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Smotion

    public interface SsdkInterface
    This interface defines common interfaces to initialize the specific SDK under com.samsung.android.sdk. All SDKs should have a representative class which implements this interface to initialize the SDK and the class name is required to represent the SDK.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getVersionCode()
      returns the version number of the SDK.
      java.lang.String getVersionName()
      returns the version name of the SDK.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(android.content.Context context)
                throws SsdkUnsupportedException
        Initiaizeds the specific SDK. All representitive packages for the SDK under com.samsung.android.sdk should implement this interface. If initialization is failed, the SDK dosen't work.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of an application
        Throws:
        SsdkUnsupportedException - Thrown if the device is not Samsung, doesn't support the feature, or the package version is not matched.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if context is null
        java.lang.SecurityException - Thrown if the required permission is not added in the AndroidManifest.xml file.

      • isFeatureEnabled

        boolean isFeatureEnabled(int type)
        Checks if the SDK supports the specific feature or not.
        Parameters:
        type - The feature ID
        Returns:
        true if the feature is enabled,
        false otherwise

      • getVersionCode

        int getVersionCode()
        returns the version number of the SDK.
        Returns:
        The SDK version number

      • getVersionName

        java.lang.String getVersionName()
        returns the version name of the SDK.
        Returns:
        The SDK version name
